content: the long tail left for this purpose prepare tassels cut 16 x 25 cm 10 in lengths of c1 eggplant yarn attach tassels use 8 lengths of yarn for each side thread the yarn through each corner at the top of the head tie in a double knot to secure calypso the kooky owl - by sharon maher of laughing purple goldfish designs ©2013 5 mini owl e r m xpe i e nt play around with different yarns using one strand of novelty yarn with two plain strands gives an excellent result try using up all your scraps of yarn just knot them all together and team them with a plain yarn for stability don t like the reverse side of your stitches showing then leave them the right way around but novelty yarns in particular look medium owl more effective from the back of the stitches use odd buttons try embroidering closed eyes for an adorable sleeping owl… or one of each for a winking owl cut different shapes for a more unusual beak braid your tassels replace the tassels with curlicues make a length of approx 15 chain work 5 single_crochet into 2nd chain from hook then work 5 single_crochet into each chain across large owl try making them in different lengths by alternating the number of starting chain for each one make them in different thicknesses by using half_double_crochet or double_crochet instead of single_crochet use a plain yarn to create a formal tassel such as the one in my online tutorial here http //laughingpurplegoldfish blogspot com a u/2008/07/make-tassels-from-yarn html try mismatched tassels for a really odd look use single_crochet to close the head instead of seaming and don t waste time weaving in any ends just secure them and leave them inside the owl… calypso the kooky owl - by sharon maher of laughing purple goldfish designs ©2013
